docs.snippet: Except for a moderately lower swing in the Canadian and Cuban remittances, last week's foreign exchange market was colorless. Little business was reported in any of the currencies, and what went on to account for the softness of Canadian and Cuban...
docs.lead_paragraph: Except for a moderately lower swing in the Canadian and Cuban remittances, last week's foreign exchange market was colorless. Little business was reported in any of the currencies, and what went on to account for the softness of Canadian and Cuban was a slight bulge in offerings over the buying interest.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED FEB. 28, 1942
FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED MARCH 7, 1942

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, March 8 -- Showing blank spaces in her trade with Asia and Europe, except Great Britain and Sweden, Brazil ended January with total exports amounting to 624,953 contos, gaining 138,911 over the same period in 1941. American nations,...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, March 8 -- Showing blank spaces in her trade with Asia and Europe, except Great Britain and Sweden, Brazil ended January with total exports amounting to 624,953 contos, gaining 138,911 over the same period in 1941. American nations, especially the United States, were responsible for the increase.

docs.snippet: In the name of rapprochement, eminently desirable between the people of the United States and the nations of South America, a concert of music by South American composers was given under the auspices of the League of Composers yesterday afternoon in...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the name of rapprochement, eminently desirable between the people of the United States and the nations of South America, a concert of music by South American composers was given under the auspices of the League of Composers yesterday afternoon in the New York Public Library.

docs.snippet: STAMPS believed to be the last ones which left Netherlands Indies prior to the Japanese invasion reached New York last week. Macy's Philatelic Center was informed from Batavia that "in accordance with the scorched earth policy it is almost certain...
docs.lead_paragraph: STAMPS believed to be the last ones which left Netherlands Indies prior to the Japanese invasion reached New York last week. Macy's Philatelic Center was informed from Batavia that "in accordance with the scorched earth policy it is almost certain that all the stamp-making equipment as well as the plates and the remaining stamps were destroyed."

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, March 14 -- Arming of Brazilian ships or a declaration of war against the Axis is not contemplated by President Getulio Vargas at the present time, it was learned today in high official circles. The informant, however, would...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, March 14 -- Arming of Brazilian ships or a declaration of war against the Axis is not contemplated by President Getulio Vargas at the present time, it was learned today in high official circles. The informant, however, would not say if such steps would be considered in the near future.

docs.snippet: The sinking of at least three, and possibly four, ships by Axis submarines operating off our Atlantic coast was disclosed yesterday. The victims were a medium-sized merchant ship of United States registry, a 5,785-ton Uruguayan vessel, an...
docs.lead_paragraph: The sinking of at least three, and possibly four, ships by Axis submarines operating off our Atlantic coast was disclosed yesterday. The victims were a medium-sized merchant ship of United States registry, a 5,785-ton Uruguayan vessel, an unidentified vessel from which fifty-seven survivors were landed in Nassau, and possibly a large United States tanker reported sunk in the Bahamas.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan SS Montevideo (former Ital SS Adamello) sunk by Axis submarine off Jeremie, Haiti; 17 dead; Uruguay retaliates; pub reaction
